text: python, "a in b" keyword, how about multiple a's?
My adventures in Python continue and my favorite books are silent again.
Python offers a built-in way to test if a variable is inside an iterable object, using the 'in' keyword:

code:
if "a" in "abrakadabra" :
  print "it is definitely here"

text: But is it possible to test if more than one item is in the list (any one)?
Currently, I'm using the syntax below, but it is kinda long:

code:
if "// @in " in sTxt or "// @out " in sTxt or "// @ret " in sTxt or <10 more>
  print "found."

text:
Of course regexes can help, but using regexes will take lots of verbose of code and will
not be as clear as "a in b".
Are there any other Pythonic ways?
